abstracts.cdata!:
This implementation completion report
            covers the Provincial Bank Privatization Loan Project and
            the Bank Reform Loan Project. The two loans were analyzed
            together because of their twin nature - identical timing and
            similar purpose. The outcome of both loans were rated
            satisfactory. Among the lessons applicable to both loans
            are: 1) Financial/fiscal crises offer opportunities for
            structural change in banking. 2) Structural/ownership change
            in banking requires resources to restructure past losses. 3)
            Even when sufficient financial resources are available,
            there will be selection bias in the roster of potential
            acquirers. It is unclear whether program design features
            alone can overcome that bias. 4) Funds were disbursed only
            after the careful review of the individual transactions. 5)
            Some of the banks created through these transactions may
            require additional restructuring as market conditions
            change. Some failures need to be anticipated. 6) A strong
            borrower commitment is indispensable in such complicated,
            time-intensive transactions.
